title: SaaS Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A SaaS benchmarks reflect expectations for proven product-market fit and scalable economics. Investors at this stage have clear thresholdsâ€”meeting or exceeding these benchmarks significantly improves fundraising outcomes. Focus on NRR and growth efficiency as primary indicators. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR)
metrics.note: Typical Series A range. Quality matters: customer concentration, segment mix, and durability of revenue.

metrics.label: ARR Growth Rate
metrics.note: Year-over-year growth rate. Should show consistent trajectory with path to sustain through Series A period.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention (NRR)
metrics.note: The defining Series A SaaS metric. Best-in-class above 120%. Below 100% is a significant hurdle.

metrics.label: Gross Revenue Retention
metrics.note: Annual customer retention before expansion. Foundation of sustainable growth.

metrics.label: LTV:CAC Ratio
metrics.note: Based on actual customer data. Series A threshold typically 3:1 with improvement trajectory.

metrics.label: CAC Payback Period
metrics.note: Months to recover acquisition cost. Efficient companies under 12 months; over 24 months concerning.

metrics.label: Burn Multiple
metrics.note: Net Burn / Net New ARR. Under 1.5x is efficient; above 3x raises efficiency concerns.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Software gross margin. Should be at or approaching target by Series A. Sub-70% requires explanation.

metrics.label: Magic Number
metrics.note: Net New ARR / S&M Spend. Indicates sales efficiency. Above 0.75 indicates efficient growth.

metrics.label: Sales Productivity
metrics.note: Annual quota attainment per sales rep. Varies by ACV and sales motion.
